name: Hell no, we won't go
description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

constellations_primary.name: Spectacle
constellations_primary.description: The moving image has captured some of history’s biggest moments. From newsreel shorts in cinemas before the show to the arrival of TV, nightly news and the 24-hour news cycle to social media, news has become a spectacle.

constellations_primary.name: Rodney King LA Riots
constellations_primary.description: The brutal beating of Rodney King by the LAPD was caught on amateur videotape and became what is arguably the first video of police brutality to go viral before the internet. It was a catalyst for the 1992 LA riots, which has influenced media ever since.

constellations_primary.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_primary.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

start.title: Hair
start.creator_credit: Miloš Forman, Ann Roth, Lester Persky, Michael Butler, CIP Filmproduktion GmbH, United Artists, Stuart Wurtzel, Gerome Ragni and James Rado
start.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 1979
start.brief_description: Hair is a 1979 musical war comedy-drama film adaptation of the 1968 Broadway musical Hair: An American Tribal Love-Rock Musical about a Vietnam War draftee, Claude, who meets and befriends a tribe of long-haired hippies on his way to the army induction center.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

end.title: Across the Universe
end.creator_credit: Julie Taymor, Albert Wolsky, Jennifer Todd, Matthew Gross, Richard Baratta, Gross Entertainment, Revolution Studios, Sound Films, Team Todd, Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais
end.brief_description: When young dockworker Jude leaves Liverpool to find his estranged father in America, he is swept up by the waves of change that are re-shaping the nation.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

links.description: Julie Taymor’s musical drama is a romance set to songs by the Beatles, against a backdrop of the Vietnam War, anti-war demonstrations, and counter-culture movement.

start.title: Front Line
start.brief_description: Front Line is a 1981 Australian documentary film directed by David Bradbury. It follows the career of Tasmanian-born combat cameraman Neil Davis, particularly his time in South Vietnam and Cambodia in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

end.title: Apocalypse Now
end.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Tom Sternberg, American Zoetrope, United Artists, Dean Tavoularis, John Milius and Michael Herr

video_links.name: APOCALYPSE NOW: FINAL CUT - Official Trailer - Dir. by Francis Ford Coppola
APOCALYPSE NOW FINAL CUT - 4K Restoration in Theaters 8/15 & on 4K Combo Pack 8/27!

end.brief_description: At the height of the Vietnam war, Captain Benjamin Willard is sent on a dangerous mission that, officially, “does not exist, nor will it ever exist.” His goal is to locate - and eliminate - a mysterious Green Beret Colonel named Walter Kurtz, who has been leading his personal army on illegal guerrilla missions into enemy territory.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

links.description: In the aftermath of the Vietnam War, popular culture focused on the horrors of the conflict. Francis Ford Coppola’s loose interpretation of Joseph Conrad’s book Heart of Darkness, transposed onto Vietnam, replicates and critiques the insanity of war.

start.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
start.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Keith Denny, Larry Brezner, Mark Johnson, Silver Screen Partners III, Touchstone Pictures, Roy Walker and Mitch Markowitz
start.brief_description: Radio funny man Adrian Cronauer is sent to Vietnam to bring a little comedy back into the lives of the soldiers.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

end.title: Hair
end.creator_credit: Miloš Forman, Ann Roth, Lester Persky, Michael Butler, CIP Filmproduktion GmbH, United Artists, Stuart Wurtzel, Gerome Ragni and James Rado
end.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 1979
end.brief_description: Hair is a 1979 musical war comedy-drama film adaptation of the 1968 Broadway musical Hair: An American Tribal Love-Rock Musical about a Vietnam War draftee, Claude, who meets and befriends a tribe of long-haired hippies on his way to the army induction center.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

links.description: The Vietnam War famously clashed with the counter-culture years of the 60s. Based on the 1968 musical, Hair is an anti-war film about a draftee who befriends a group of hippies and is introduced to hallucinogenics and draft evasion.

start.title: Apocalypse Now
start.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Tom Sternberg, American Zoetrope, United Artists, Dean Tavoularis, John Milius and Michael Herr

video_links.name: APOCALYPSE NOW: FINAL CUT - Official Trailer - Dir. by Francis Ford Coppola
APOCALYPSE NOW FINAL CUT - 4K Restoration in Theaters 8/15 & on 4K Combo Pack 8/27!

start.brief_description: At the height of the Vietnam war, Captain Benjamin Willard is sent on a dangerous mission that, officially, “does not exist, nor will it ever exist.” His goal is to locate - and eliminate - a mysterious Green Beret Colonel named Walter Kurtz, who has been leading his personal army on illegal guerrilla missions into enemy territory.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

end.title: Taxi Driver
end.creator_credit: Julia Phillips, Michael Phillips and Bill/Phillips
end.brief_description: Taxi Driver is one of the most iconic films of the 1970s. The savage story of a social misfit from screenwriter Paul Schrader is powerfully directed by Martin Scorsese, with compelling performances from Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster and Harvey Keitel.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

constellations_other.name: Reflecting duality and revealing new realities
constellations_other.description: The Toupie Fantoche relies on four prismatic mirrors to reflect changes in animation states.

constellations_other.name: Colour and creativity
constellations_other.description: From dying film to Technicolor and beyond, creative applications of colour have been part of cinema since its inception.

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

recommendations.quote: De Niro’s Travis Bickle is one of the key figures of American cinema; the passage of his taxi through the grubby, smoky streets of the city – accompanied by the great composer Bernard Herrmann’s final score – are unforgettable.  So are his improvised monologues - "Are you talking to me?”

links.description: Films about the Vietnam War in the 1970s also tended to focus on the trauma of returning veterans. Neo-noir psychological thriller Taxi Driver follows the story of a lonely taxi driver’s descent into madness in New York City.

start.title: Vietnam War
start.brief_description: The Vietnam War is known as ‘the television war’. Images from the front nightly entered people’s living rooms through on-the-ground reportage. As the war progressed, public support waned and by 1969 protests were held, which were also televised.

constellations_other.name: Spectacle
constellations_other.description: The moving image has captured some of history’s biggest moments. From newsreel shorts in cinemas before the show to the arrival of TV, nightly news and the 24-hour news cycle to social media, news has become a spectacle.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

end.title: Front Line
end.brief_description: Front Line is a 1981 Australian documentary film directed by David Bradbury. It follows the career of Tasmanian-born combat cameraman Neil Davis, particularly his time in South Vietnam and Cambodia in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

links.description: Front Line chronicled the career of combat photographer Neil Davis, known for his intrepid reporting on conflicts such as the Vietnam War. The war was the first time that people saw scenes from the front on their television screens.

start.title: Apocalypse Now
start.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Tom Sternberg, American Zoetrope, United Artists, Dean Tavoularis, John Milius and Michael Herr

end.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
end.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Keith Denny, Larry Brezner, Mark Johnson, Silver Screen Partners III, Touchstone Pictures, Roy Walker and Mitch Markowitz
end.brief_description: Radio funny man Adrian Cronauer is sent to Vietnam to bring a little comedy back into the lives of the soldiers.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

links.description: Inspired by the real life experiences of Adrian Cronauer, Good Morning, Vietnam stars Robin Williams as an unorthodox and irreverent radio DJ stationed in Saigon in 1965, providing entertainment and music for the American troops.

links.description: Footage of the Vietnam War, known as the Television War, features prominently in the Spectacle section of Moving Minds in The Story of the Moving Image.
